metadata.title: Insurance Student Health Insurance | Student Health Services

chunks.content:
To see if you have a Student Insurance (SI) Hold, click here for a review guide.  To remove the SI hold for Fall 2024: Complete the Fall Agreement Form by clicking here Allow 24 business hours for the SI hold to be removedStudents under an F or J visa are required to carry health insurance that meets the
               minimum coverage requirements per Florida Board of Governor's Regulation 6.009 and 
               USF Regulation 6.0162 International students have the option to enroll in the USF sponsored health insurance
                     Plan (SHIP) through Academic HealthPlans (AHP) OR waive out with an adequate alternative
                     policy before the deadline. To activate your enrollment in the USF SHIP underwritten by Aetna, you will need to

metadata.title: Insurance Student Health Insurance | Student Health Services

chunks.content:
policy before the deadline. To activate your enrollment in the USF SHIP underwritten by Aetna, you will need to
               pay the premium directly through OASIS no later than August 26, 2024. USF SHIP features comprehensive coverage exceeding FL-BOG and USF's regulations. From July 15, 2024 to August 26, 2024, you have the opportunity to waive/opt out of USF SHIP. You need to submit proof
               of your alternative policy to AHP directly for review/consideration. If you miss the August 26th final submission deadline, you WILL be required to purchase the USF SHIP for the Fall 2024 semester. Students under an F or J visa  Have your health insurance company complete the USF Insurance Compliance (Waiver) form and submit it to AHP, along with the front and back of your insurance card for review no later than August

metadata.title: Insurance Student Health Insurance | Student Health Services

chunks.content:
26, 2024. Students under a non-F or J visa  You must submit a copy of the front and back of your health insurance card to AHP for review: Please note: the USF premium will not be removed from your OASIS account unless your
                  policy meets the minimum requirements of the mandate and is officially approved by
                  AHP and USF.  In the meantime, when paying tuition and fees, subtract the insurance
                  premium from your total and pay the remaining amount. The insurance premium fee on
                  your account will not generate a late fee, if left unpaid.If you are experiencing issues with uploading proof of your alternative policy, please

chunks.content:
your account will not generate a late fee, if left unpaid.If you are experiencing issues with uploading proof of your alternative policy, please
                     contact Academic HealthPlans (AHP) at (888) 896-5797 or click here. Click here for some frequently asked questions. Click here for commonly used insurance terms. Contact Us Telephone: 813-974-2331, option 5Fax: (813) 974-8910 TAMPA OFFICE HOURS MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY FROM 8AM TO 5PMPHONE LINES AVAILABLE MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY FROM 10AM TO 4PM
